answers.answer: How far along are you? Try drinking LOTS of water and elevating your feet. If no improvement at all I would get checked. Also make sure you're watching your salt intake.
sounds like you are severely dehydrated i agree you need to drink alot of water and/or gatorade the gatorade will put electrolites back in your body

Happens to me if I eat too much salty foods, don't drink enough water, or am standing too much. If I drink a couple glasses of cold water and lay back with my feet up above heart level it usually goes down at least a little bit. If you try the water and elevating your feet and it doesn't go down at all in a couple of hours (and don't expect it to go down completely cuz it's possible it doesn't go down fully until after delivery like mine) then call your labor and delivery office and ask to speak to a nurse about it. It could be a sign of pre eclampsia (extreme high blood pressure during pregnancy).

I have been drinking lots of water. But i really dont pay attention on the salt. But it may be the dehydration. So ill do that for now. My next appointment is on tuesday. Im 35 weeks. I googled preeclampsia symptoms but i just dont get it. Its my first baby.
Ive got tons of swelling.  As long as everything else is ok, like your blood pressure, its probably just a pesky side effect of pregnancy, and baby not allowing as much bloodflow.

My cousin had it with her first baby and it lead to a thing called toxemia poisoning or something. No ones trying to diagnose you here just giving you a heads up. If you sleep more on your left side tonight (it helps blood flow and digestion and all sorts of other things) it might help too so just try not to stress tonight. If its concerning you tomorrow call the office and talk to a nurse just to see if they're concerned and want you in sooner than Tuesday. As a ftm no question is ever too stupid or too much of a duh answer to call and ask. I'm on number two and I still get those weird questions lol
Its called pitting edema so tell them its that and they'll be like oh she knows what she's talking about!  And no that's never good!

question: My feet are swelling up to my knees but not my toes. I called my clinic to tell them but its closed so a 24/7nurse answer the call and said its normal. But this time is diffrent from the other times they've swollen. When i touch it a hole remains where i touch it for like a minute and then goes back up. Is this normal? Please i need info on this.
title: swelling?
